metadata.description: Black Mountain College timeline with precise dates

1933-09-25.description: First day of classes at Blue Ridge Assembly. 10 founding faculty, 22 students.

1933-11-28.description: Josef and Anni Albers arrive from Germany, fleeing the Nazi regime after the Bauhaus was closed. Josef will teach art until 1949.

1936-04-01.description: Louis Adamic's article brings national attention to BMC's educational experiment.

1938-06-15.description: Artists and intellectuals fleeing Nazi Germany join faculty.

1941-12-08.description: Community meeting to discuss US entry into WWII. Some students leave to enlist.

1942-01-01.description: Reduced enrollment, rationing, students leaving for military service.

1946-09-01.description: Post-war enrollment surge. Veterans using GI Bill benefits.

1948-04-01.event: John Cage and Merce Cunningham first visit
1948-04-01.description: Cage and Cunningham visit BMC on their way to the West Coast. Cage premieres Sonatas and Interludes for prepared piano.

1948-06-22.description: Legendary summer with Willem de Kooning, Buckminster Fuller, Merce Cunningham, John Cage. Erik Satie's The Ruse of Medusa performed.

1948-07-04.description: Geodesic dome construction. Collapses but proves concept.

1948-09-01.description: Poet Charles Olson becomes visiting professor, replacing Edward Dahlberg for the academic year.

1949-02-01.description: Albers announces resignation. Will leave at end of school year in May.

1949-05-01.event: Josef and Anni Albers leave BMC
1949-05-01.description: The Alberses leave Black Mountain College after 16 years. Josef will join Yale in 1950.

1949-06-01.description: Serious budget shortfall. Debate about college future.

1950-06-15.description: Influential art critic teaches during summer, delivering lectures on modernist painting. Kenneth Noland among his students.

1951-09-01.description: Olson returns to BMC faculty after absence. Poetry and writing become increasingly central.

1951-04-01.description: Cid Corman's poetry magazine, closely tied to BMC poets.

1952-08-16.description: Cage, Cunningham, Rauschenberg, Tudor, Olson, Richards create first 'Happening' in the dining hall. Historic multimedia event.

1953-01-01.description: Charles Olson assumes leadership as Rector after many faculty depart. Transforms college toward poetry and writing.

1954-03-01.description: Robert Creeley edits literary magazine from Mallorca. First issue includes Olson, Blackburn, Zukofsky, Levertov, Duncan.

1954-06-15.description: Rauschenberg creates key works during summer residency.

1955-09-01.description: Only 9 students enrolled. Minimal operations continue.

1956-03-01.description: Last regular semester of classes. Only handful of students remain.

1956-09-01.description: Farm sold. Olson and Wesley Huss decide to close the college.

1957-03-01.description: Courts order Olson to cease programs. Official closure after 24-year experiment in education. Final issue of Black Mountain Review appears in autumn.
